instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  CD3215C00 showed bad on thermal
threads.message:
UB300 fail.   Showed on thermal.  Still unable to get 1v1 LDO off pin 35
replaced UB3400 as well.   Still no 1v1 LDO off pin 35 either chip.

UB3200 and UB3100 do generate 1v1 LDO


Still don't have the unit at 20


Anyone have experience with this LB

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  CD3215C00 showed bad on thermal
threads.message:
Are you sure <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips used are good?
Compare diode mode readings with the other two chips.

Any history fault available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  CD3215C00 showed bad on thermal
threads.message:
I pulled them new out of the box.
the unit came in with "dead no power".   I am the first person to work on it. 

I will diode check them again.    I can change them again as I have already picked the underfill off so now it's not a big deal
